title: Ticket #963: Have a Condor event logging daemon that does all log file writing
description: Have all log events written by an event writing daemon -- this would avoid probems with permissions on EventLog, log file locking, partial events written to log, etc.
remarks:
2010-Mar-17 11:21:23 by tstclair:
There are numerous ways to deal with this one, we've conversed about making a transparent file like interface behind which one could "plug-in" an impl to say syslog, or possibly a qpid backend.

2010-Dec-28 09:26:17 by alderman:
+1

2014-Jan-10 11:27:15 by wenger:
Discussion with ToddT...

Three main phases:

  1. Get event writing out of schedd
  2. Get event writing out of shadow
  3. Get event writing out of gridmanager

The idea is that this daemon would essentially do a tail of the SchedLog to get the info it needs; schedd maybe couldn't compress the log until the event writer daemon has caught up. Event writer would have to keep its own state of where it has gotten to in the SchedLog (and maybe where it has fsynced to, if we separate event writing and fsycing).
